article.headline: Marshall 74, St. Bonaventure 65
article.story: ST. BONAVENTURE, N.Y. -- Damier Pitts scored 25 points and Marshall held off a second-half comeback to defeat St. Bonaventure 74-65 on Sunday. Marshall led 54-39 in the second half and the Bonnies went on a 13-1 run to cut the lead to 55-52 with 6:56 to play on a dunk by Da'Quan Cook. Marshall responded with a 13-3 run to put the game out of reach at 68-55 with 1:19 to play after a free throw by Pitts. Marshall made 11 of 14 free throws in the final 1:41. Pitts made 6 of 10 free throws for the game and shot 7 of 13 from the field. Shaquille Johnson added 14 points for the Thundering Herd (10-3), who have won two games in a row and seven of their past eight. Andrew Nicholson scored 29 points, Michael Davenport added 14 and Demitrius Conger had 12 for the Bonnies (7-5), whose past seven games each have been decided by nine points or less, including two in overtime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
